resources.string: This is the main screen, with 6 different options to choose. They are random playlists, according to your mood. The source could be any kind of external application as Spotify, lastfm, or many others. Each category is linked to a new activity launched through explicit intents and eventListeners. (Onclicklistener class). On the below menu The "Search" TextView eventlistener would open a searching field fragment through a similar coding structure. Music Store TextView will show up the Music Store activity thought the same classes and events.

This main activity got a list of random artists and songs played automatically by Media Player. By clicking the plus sign, an explicit intent will launch the app to the artist profile activity. By clicking the artist cover, another intent will show up the playingnow activity. The "Search" TextView eventlistener would open fragment through a similar coding structure. To select the song as favourite the method setImageResource has been used.

Media player controls will play automatically the current artist music. The button play/stop is coded calling also Media Player for these actions. Similar coding for the buttons forward/backard. There are also menus (intents with eventlisteners) to navigate to the rest of the screens (Activities).

This is the Artist profile screen, with all the artist information. The TextView "Main" is linked with the MainActivity through explicit intent and the class Onclicklistener. The same code has been structured for the TextView "Music Store" .The "Search" TextView eventlistener would open fragment showing up a searching field.

In this music store, purchase of songs can be made by clicking the "Buy it now" Button which send the activity to Android Pay API for the payment process, through and explicit intent and an event listener ( Onclicklistener ).It also uses an Onclicklistener class for the payments layout, in order to pop it up on the same screen at the bottom. There is also a menu to navigate through explicit intents to the rest of the screens( Activities).
